data.title: Postman by David Brin, Signed
data.meta_description: The Postman by Brin, David and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Soft cover. Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First editions. Three advance volumes. The Postman is an ARC, the Glory Season is the 62 page excerpt and the Foundation book is the proof. All three volumes are signed by the author ( one inscribed). A sticker is affixed to the plastic outer wrapper of the Foundation book. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. First Edition. Inscribed by author, David Brin. 1st edition. Hardcover and dust jacket. Good binding and cover. Clean, unmarked pages. Post-apocalyptic fiction. Winner of the John W. Campbell Memorial Award for Best Science Fiction Novel and the Locus Award for Best Science Fiction Novel. Nominated for the Hugo Award for Best Novel and Nebula Award for Best Novel for 1986. Signed.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Flat signed by author, David Brin. 1st edition, 1st printing. Hardcover and dust jacket. Good binding and cover. Clean, unmarked pages. Blind stamp on half title. Post-apocalyptic fiction. Winner of the John W. Campbell Memorial Award for Best Science Fiction Novel and the Locus Award for Best Science Fiction Novel. Nominated for the Hugo Award for Best Novel and Nebula Award for Best Novel for 1986. Signed.

Leather. Condition: SIGNED / VG. SIGNED BY BRIN. bound in bonded leather with raised bands, gilt titles and decorations. all edges gilt. silk moire endsheets. ribbon bookmark bound in. no previous owner signatures or marks. pages and binding are clean, straight and tight. there are no marks to the text or other serious flaws. Signed By Author.

Condition: Very fine. The Easton Press. A very fine copy bound in full leather by The Easton Press. Signed by the author David Brin. Notes, bookplate and Certificate of Authenticity laid in. No bumped corners to book or spine tips. Gold gilt edges are very clean and bright.

Full-Leather. Condition: Very Fine/New. Collector's Edition. True 22kt gold accents deeply inlaid upon raised "hubbed" spine with Smyth-sewn pages and printed on rich and durable archival-quality acid free paper which will not yellow with age. It features excellent end sheets and premium heavy duty boards with a sewn in satin page marker. A new unattached bookplate is provided. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: As New. No Jacket. Published by Easton Press. As-New condition leather & bright gilt hardcover, SIGNED edition still in original shrinkwrap. Has all the superior quality characteristics that Easton Press is known for. Same or next day shipping. Please email any questions. Signed by Author(s).

Full Leather. Condition: Fine. Collector's Edition. A beautiful Collector's Edition of David Brin's award-winning book,signed by the author on the signature page and bound in fine dark navy blue leather. This is the first time "The Postman" was issued in a signed edition. With gold gilt cover designs and page edges, and bound-in silk bookmark. Includes the Publisher's Note and copy of the Easton Press Certificate of Authenticity. "The Postman" won the Campbell andf Locus Awards and was nominated for Hugo and Nebula awards as well. Made into a major motion picture starring Kevin Costner in 1997. A wonderful copy just removed from the original shrinkwrap for pictures and then wrapped to preserve its beautiful condition. An unsigned edition was published by Easton Press in 1993 with a different cover.

Full Leather. Condition: New. Collector's Edition. Still in the original shrinkwrap straight from the publisher! A beautiful Collector's Edition of David Brin's award-winning book,signed by the author on the signature page and bound in fine dark navy blue leather. This is the first time "The Postman" was issued in a signed edition. With gold gilt cover designs and page edges, and bound-in silk bookmark. Includes the Publisher's Note and copy of the Easton Press Certificate of Authenticity. "The Postman" won the Campbell andf Locus Awards and was nominated for Hugo and Nebula awards as well. Made into a major motion picture starring Kevin Costner in 1997. A wonderful copy still in the original shrinkwrap, wrapped to preserve its new condition. An unsigned edition was published by Easton Press in 1993 with a different cover.
